reviewText: The game works great and plays great. Did not experience any crashes. However, I did experience connection network errors trying to connect to online. After a few tries I got it working and played with a friend. It was a lot of fun. I recommend this if you like scrabble and have friends online on steam to play with.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText: My friends are teasing me relentlessly because as an only child I played nothing but Scrabble with my parents.  I played Scrabble with two of my best friends tonight and an ill-fated turn of events caused an unfair victory against me.  They took everything from me.\n\n10/10

reviewText:
Updated:

Developer fixed Tutor mode bug (and hopefully the occasional mode randomization, too - at least I didn't encounter it anymore so far), so I am updating the verdict:

This is now fun in single player mode, too.

Although you might want to be aware of the profanity-clean dictionary, I can now recommend this game.

It's hard to mess up making a board game, but I feel this one is mediocre.

It would be very nice to be able to look up in the dictionary unchallenged words already on the board. The AI just played gorea" and I find no definition of it online. Being able to look up words is also a good way to teach kids their meaning.

The AI speed annoys me. It seems to be deliberately slowed down to feel "realistic"
date: but after all the waiting and the sound and animation effects
recommended:
the result is most of the time spent by you in the game involves idly staring at the screen.

The game also crashed when I finished the tutorial and tried to play a real game. I'm hoping that's not a sign of bugginess throughout the product.

Compared to the competitors
hoursPlayed: the game does have a nice and polished look
voteText: which is why I chose to purchase it. However
helpfulPercent: I think asking nearly CAN$8 for it a bit too much. CAN$4 is a fairer price.\n\nSince competition is very slim
votesHelpful: I'm siding with "Yes" on the recommendation
votesTotal: but the game can use significant improvement to make it more enjoyable."
